smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found. All 19 pages contain at least one element - including package diagrams, use case diagrams, class diagrams, activity diagram, state diagram, and database diagrams.

On page 2 'Autode funktsionaalne allsüsteem (Vaata & Tuvasta)', the use case 'Tuvasta kasutaja' is a visual oval element that has ZERO actor associations. While actors Uudistaja, Klienditeenindaja, Juhataja, Klient, and Autode haldur are present on the diagram, 'Tuvasta kasutaja' appears without any connecting lines to any of these actors.

No duplicate use case names describing the same activity with the same actor were found. Use cases across pages 2 and 3 have distinct names: 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid', 'Vaata kõiki autosid', 'Vaata autode koondaruannet', 'Registreeri auto', 'Lõpeta auto', 'Muuda autot', 'Aktiveeri auto', 'Muuda auto mittaktiivseks', 'Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid', 'Unusta auto' - all represent different activities.
On page 1 (package diagram), all model elements within each package have unique names. No duplicate element names were found within any single package.

While column names like 'nimetus' and 'on_aktiivne' appear in multiple tables (pages 14-19), these represent different contextual data for different entities (e.g., nimetus in Riik vs Auto_kategooria represents name of country vs name of car category). All shared data between tables is properly connected via Foreign Key relationships.

All use case names follow a consistent verb-first naming pattern in Estonian: 'Tuvasta' (Identify), 'Vaata' (View), 'Registreeri' (Register), 'Lõpeta' (Terminate), 'Muuda' (Modify), 'Aktiveeri' (Activate), 'Unusta' (Forget) - all start with imperative verbs.

On page 9 'Auto seisundidiagramm', all 6 states (Algus, Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Lõpetatud, Unustatud) can be reached. Algus is the initial state. Ootel receives from Algus. Aktiivne receives from Ootel and Mitteaktiivne. Mitteaktiivne receives from Aktiivne. Lõpetatud receives from Aktiivne and Mitteaktiivne. Unustatud receives from Ootel.

On page 4 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm', all actions can be reached from the start node (Algus): 'Vaata kõiki autosid, mida saab lõpetada' (directly from Algus), 'Otsi autot' (via decision), 'Vali auto' (via decision flow), 'Lõpeta valitud auto' (follows from Vali auto).

All relationships in class and database diagrams have multiplicity indicators on both ends. Examples: pages 14-19 show FK relationships with '0..*', '1', '0..1' multiplicities; pages 5-13 class diagrams show '0..1', '0..*', '1' multiplicities on all relationship ends.

Counted central elements per diagram: Page 5: 3 classes; Page 6: 5 classes; Page 7: 6 classes; Page 8: 6 classes; Page 9: 6 states; Page 10: 5 classes; Page 11: 3 classes; Page 12: 7 classes; Page 13: 3 classes; Page 14: 4 tables; Page 15: 9 tables (Tootaja_roll, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Auto_kategooria_tyyp, Riik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, Auto_kytuse_liik, Kliendi_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark, Auto_kategooria); Page 16: 3 tables; Page 17: 6 tables; Page 18: 2 tables; Page 19: 5 tables. Maximum is 9. Threshold is ≥10. Since 9 < 10, smell is NOT present.

Counted visual connection lines per element on each diagram page. Page 17: Auto has 4 visible lines (to Auto_kategooria_omamine, Auto_kytuse_liik, Auto_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark). Page 19: Tootaja has 4 visible lines (to Isik, self-reference, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, Tootaja_rolli_omamine). Maximum connections from any single element is 5. Threshold is ≥6. Since 5 < 6, smell is NOT present.

Visual inspection of all diagrams shows related elements are positioned reasonably close to each other. No relationship appears to span more than twice the average distance between elements on any diagram.

All use case names on pages 2-3 start with active verbs (Estonian imperative form): Tuvasta, Vaata, Registreeri, Lõpeta, Muuda, Aktiveeri, Unusta. All activity diagram actions on page 4 also start with verbs: Vaata, Otsi, Vali, Lõpeta.

All class, table, attribute, and use case names have 4 or more characters. Shortest names found: 'Isik' (4 chars), 'Auto' (4 chars), 'Riik' (4 chars). Threshold is ≤3 characters. Since 4 > 3, smell is NOT present.
All class names start with uppercase letters and are singular: Isik, Auto, Klient, Töötaja, Kasutajakonto, Klassifikaator, Riik, etc.
All attribute/column names in database diagrams (pages 14-19) start with lowercase letters: isik_id, isikukood, riik_kood, e_meil, nimetus, on_aktiivne, parool, etc.
All database table names are singular: Isik, Kasutajakonto, Riik, Tootaja_roll, Auto_kategooria, Klient, Tootaja, Auto, Auto_kategooria_omamine, etc.

Type prefixes found in attribute names. On page 7 'Klassifikaatorite register (Auto)' and page 8 'Klassifikaatorite register (Isik)', the Klassifikaator class contains attributes with type prefixes: 'bool_on_aktiivne: boolean' (bool_ prefix indicates boolean type), 'chr_nimetus: char' (chr_ prefix indicates character type), 'chr_kood: char' (chr_ prefix indicates character type). These are Hungarian notation type prefixes that violate the rule.
